alert.note: Alert for Buckingham (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 4:42PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Buckingham County through 530 PM EDT... At 440 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms from Scottsville to Wingina, moving east at 25 mph. Additional strong thunderstorms were moving into the western part of the county from Nelson County. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. Frequent Cloud-to-Ground Lightning. Very heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Cloud-to-Ground Lightning can strike objects, structures, and people. Heavy rainfall can result in localized flooding. Locations impacted include... Buckingham... Dillwyn... New Canton... Toga... Centenary... Andersonville... and Wingina. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
